summary: The DMEPOS Relief Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to adjust Medicare payments for durable medical equipment (DME) previously included in the 2021 competitive bidding program. The bill focuses on payment rates in non-competitive bidding areas, especially affecting implementation timelines for certain regulations.  It aims to provide relief related to Medicare reimbursement for DME, affecting areas other than rural and noncontiguous ones, and postpones the implementation of a specific regulation until 2026.
